Sentencas: Operability of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) on numerous fuels has been widely counted as a leading advantage in literature.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: In a designed system, however, switching from a fuel to another is not practically a straightforward task as this causes several system performance issues in both dynamic and steady-state modes.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: In order to demonstrate the system fuel diversity capabilities, these consequences must be well-evaluated by quantifying the characteristic measures for numerous fuel cases and also potential combinations.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: From this viewpoint, the numerical predictive models play a critical role.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: This paper aims to investigate the performance of a SOFC system fed by various fuels using a demonstrated system level model.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: Process configuration and streams results of a real-life SOFC system rig published in literature are used to validate the model.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: The presented model is capable not only of capturing the system performance measures but also the SOFC internal variable distributions, allowing the multiscale study of fuel switching scenarios.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: The fuel change impacts on the system are simulated by considering various fuel sources, i.e., natural gas, biogas, and syngas.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: Moreover, applications of simulated fuel mixtures are assessed.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: The modelling results show significant concerns about fuel switching in a system in terms of variation of efficiencies, stack internal temperature and current density homogeneity, and environmental issues.
Titulo: Evaluation of fuel diversity in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell system

Sentencas: Moreover, the results reveal opportunities for multi-fuel design to address the operation and application requirements such as optimisation of the anode off gas recycling rate and the thermal-to-electrical ratio as well as the system specific greenhouse gases, i.e., g-COx/Wh release.
